title: Police: Lancaster shooting not as reported
content:
A reported shooting in Lancaster has turned out to be self-inflicted and accidental, police said.
Police said a 24-year-old man walked in to a local hospital around 7:25 p.m. with a wound to the hand and said he was shot at South Ann and Dauphin streets.
It was soon determined that the man had accidentally shot himself in the hand in the 300 block of South Broad Street, Detective Sgt. Nathan Nickel said. Police located a gun in the block a short time after the shooting was reported.
Nickel said the man's injury is not life-threatening.
